intro: Urophyllum chinense subsp. latistipulum, commonly known as the broad-tipped Chinese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountain forests and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lanceolate and often have a hairy texture, while the stems are upright and branching. The subspecies is distinguished by its broader, more robust flower petals compared to other members of the species.
